page.title: 12Recreation in Sebergham 2
page.content: The sporting rights of Parsons Park, Dentonside Wood and Ninegills are all let to tenants for shooting and roe deer stalking. Parsons Park and Ninegills are very thick and afford roe deer stalking and pigeon shooting. Dentonside, much of which was re- planted in 1978, is run as a syndicate pheasant shoot. Wild pheasants are encouraged by providing dusting shelters, ample feed and control of mink, stoats and weasels. These are supplemented each year by the release of six week old poults in early August Shooting is organised on six days during November, December and January. The countryside is ideal for those who seek their leisure and relaxation in walking. The views are magnificent and varied and access is easy by rights of way and tolerant landowners.
